text:
Hi Everyone,
I want to display a list of contact data on the website. I plan to use the HubSpot Private App API. However, is it possible to achieve this without using serverless functions?

Hello. I'm trying to modify our organization's Subscription preferences page. I already cloned the default subscription template and assigned it in our settings, so now I'm just trying to get the code right. One thing I can't seem to figure out is how to reference contact data so we can post things like names, properties, etc, of whoever is visiting that page. I tried to reference this page of HubL variables - <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/reference/cms/hubl/variables#required-email-template-variables> - but for things like "account" or "contact" I'm either getting no output at all or "null".
Or PyLimitingSizeMap, which tells me nothing

Can you go into a bit more detail as to what you're trying to do? You can display the current contacts information easily using hubl on an access controlled page. Are you trying to do something more complicated than that?

Hey <@U07MAGZJL0Y> - had a similar case/request a while ago... After some chat's with HS I got the info that the preference/subscription page(s) do not have any personalization possibilities and the only thing that is getting pulled from the CRM is the email-adress. Anything else is not possible.

I've seen(and worked) with solutions made by other devs/agencies/partners that had a personalized subscription page - BUT, this is def. something you don't want to start doing since it's similar to "Guarantee voided if sticker is removed", this is why I don't want to describe how it was accomplished. :slightly_smiling_face:
I thought that by default the Subscription Preferences page is able to mark what subscriptions a contact has/has not subscribed to?

Hi <@U05AG9W9FN1> For example, I have a *HIVE Xmas Card Yes List* (a CRM list) and want to display specific property information for each person who is part of this list. I need to create a page with the following functionality:
1. *Search Functionality*: Allow users to search based on postcodes.
2. *Country-wise Filter*: Add a filter to display contacts by country.
3. Only include contact information from the *HIVE Xmas Card Yes List* — not the entire contact list.

it should do this, yes.
But there are a few things that you have to keep in mind:
• the pref center behaves differently when
    ◦ you're sending test-mails
    ◦ sending (test-)mails from "hs-sites-" domains
    ◦ you're testing it in a developer account
If non of those options above applies and you can test it in a real environment but with a different theme - test it with something like growth to exclude a theme issue. Technically a theme provider is able to put some sort of JS in, that will override this default behaviour.
